oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photograph of James Coble's grave marker
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of James Coble's grave marker accompanied by the transcript of an article detailing Coble's death. He was a membe of the 10th Tenn. Cav. (Forrest's) Regt., CSA. Coble was the sole casualty in a skirmish near Jackson, Tenn., in December 1862. His burial site remained unmarked and unknown to his family for 51 years.
